byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Moscow, and Steven Erlanger from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow, and Peter Baker, Eric Schmitt and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.
byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and STEVEN ERLANGER

abstract: Turkish fighter jets shoot down Russian warplane that Turkey claims entered its airspace, first time NATO country has shot down Russian plane in half a century; incident raises tensions between Russia, Turkey and NATO and diminishes possibility of diplomatic solution to Syrian conflict, over which Russia and Turkey differ.
lead_paragraph: In a clash with Cold War overtones, Turkey shot down a Russian warplane that it said had strayed into its territory. Russia called the incident a “stab in the back.”

headline.main: NATO-Russia Tensions Rise After Turkey Downs Jet
headline.print_headline: Turkey Brings Down Russia Warplane on Syrian Mission

snippet: In a clash with Cold War overtones, Turkey shot down a Russian warplane that it said had strayed into its territory. Russia called the incident a “stab in the back.”

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
